Event.0: Emperor Constantius II shuts all heathen temples
Event.1: American author Harper Lee—who was nationally acclaimed and revered for her first novel, To Kill a Mockingbird (1960), which movingly depicts small-town life and racial prejudice—died in Monroeville, Alabama.
Event.2: Toshiba announces its formal recall of its HD DVD video format, ending the format war between it and Sony's Blu-Ray Disc
Event.3: Fidel Castro formally resigned as president of Cuba; he was succeeded by his brother Raúl.
Event.4: Deng Xiaoping, who introduced economic reforms to China in 1978, died in Beijing.
Event.5: "Baywatch" actress Pamela Anderson (27) weds rocker Tommy Lee (32) in Cancun, Mexico
Event.6: George Harrison is ordered to pay ABKCO Music $587,000 for "subconscious plagiarism" of his song "My Sweet Lord" with Ronnie Mack's song "He's So Fine"
Event.7: Actor Peter Sellers (38) weds actress Britt Ekland in London, England
Event.8:
Roger Goodell
American sports commissioner
was born
Event.9:
Cristina Fernández de Kirchner
president of Argentina
was born
Event.10: Giants outfielder Danny Gardella is 1st major leaguer to announce he is jumping to the "outlaw" Mexican League
Event.11:
Iwo Jima invaded by U.S. Marines
On this day in 1945, during the final phases of World War II, U.S. Marines invaded Iwo Jima so as to wrest control of the strategically important island from the Japanese, who put up fierce resistance in the ensuing battle.
Event.12: US 5th Fleet launches invasion of Iwo Jima against the Japanese with 30,000 US Marines
Event.13: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed the executive order allowing the internment of Japanese Americans during World War II.
Event.14: About 150 Japanese warplanes attack the Australian city of Darwin
Event.15: US entertainer Bob Hope weds fellow entertainer Dolores DeFina
Event.16:
Lee Marvin
American actor
was born
Event.17:
Merle Oberon
British-American actress
was born
Event.18: Kansas became the first U.S. state to include the prohibition of alcoholic beverages in its state constitution.
Event.19: American inventor Thomas Edison patented the phonograph.
Event.20: Thomas Edison is granted a patent for his gramophone (phonograph)
Event.22: Peruvian stratovolcano Huaynaputina explodes in the most violent eruption in South American recorded history
